statement: Prove that there is one and only one triangle whose side lengths are consecutive integers and one of whose angles is twice as large as another.
Find all natural numbers x such that the product of their digits equals x² − 10x − 22.

Consider the cyclic system x_{i+1} = a x_i² + b x_i + c (i = 1,...,n, x_{n+1}=x_1) with a ≠ 0 and Δ = (b−1)² − 4ac. Prove: (a) if Δ < 0, no solution; (b) if Δ = 0, exactly one solution; (c) if Δ > 0, more than one solution.
Prove that in every tetrahedron there is a vertex such that the three edges meeting there have lengths which are the sides of a triangle.
Let f be real-valued satisfying f(x+a) = ½ + √(f(x) − f(x)²) for some constant a > 0 and all x. (a) Prove f is periodic. (b) For a = 1 exhibit a non-constant example.
For every natural number n evaluate the infinite sum [n/2] + [n+1/4] + [n+2/8] + ... + [n+2^k/2^{k+1}] + ... (square brackets denote floor function).
